Event.name: Aging
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> is undergoing a change in age typically associated with some deterioration or change in state.
<ex><fex name="Entity">This bark</fex> <t>ages</t> and turns black.</ex>
<ex>The U.S. is to upgrade <t>aging</t> <fex name="Entity">missile defense systems</fex> with advanced tech.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Some specification of the circumstances under which the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes the aging event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (<ment>hard</ment>, <ment>softly</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In agentive frames, it may indicate salient characteristics of an intentional Theme that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously</ment>, <ment>coldly</ment>, <ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>, <ment>carefully</ment>).
<ex>These kinds of condoms <t>aged</t> <fex name="Manner">quickly</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates where the <fen>Entity</fen> is located. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: aging.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of growing older.
